history.content:
Come join GREP and learn ML!

Club members from Machine Learning @ Berkeley are piloting a new program -- Guided Resource and Education Program in Machine Learning (GREP), designed to give newcomers a guided introduction into the world of ML. Some questions we hope to help members address: Where can ML be impactful? What topics does ML research cover and how are they important? What are the limitations and possibilities of ML? How do I engage with specific topics further?

We hope to provide members with a platform to understand where to start and what to work on, while building a community throughout. This includes getting matched with an ML@B mentor and provided with comprehensive resources for further ML education and opportunities. We will host “how-to” style educational workshops (research, recruiting, ethics, side projects), group socials, tech talks, and mini reading groups. This is a great opportunity to craft a guided and supervised plan that works towards some personal learning goals of yours — whatever they might be!

Visit our website for more information on how to apply at bit.ly/grep-info. Apply at http://tinyurl.com/grep-fa21 by Monday, 9/13 11:59 PM (PDT). This program is designed for beginners and all majors, no prior ML experience necessary. Hope to see you there!
history.subject: Join GREP: Guided Resource and Education Program in Machine Learning!
